_header: The high father of bliss above
_description: James Ryman, a hymn of praise to God — six quatrains (aaab) with ‘Te deum laudamus’ refrain and burden: ‘Singe we alle this tyme thus / Te deum laudamus’

CULEe112.First Lines:
The high fader of blisse aboueSent his owne sonne to oure
                    behove…
CULEe112.Last Lines: …His holy name and glorifieTe deum laudamus
